means: 挡开，避开，闪开（打击、武器）

sentence.Network_en: Martin Parry, author of the report, says it's time for concerted action by world leaders.
sentence.Network_cn: 该报道的作者马丁·帕里宣称是世界各国的首脑采取一致行动的时候了。

sentence.Network_en: I did not want to wound him, but to restrict myself to defence, to parry his attacks.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不想伤害他，只是想自我防卫，挡开他的攻击。

sentence.Network_en: We sought to parry the charateristic Soviet lunge with fancy footwork.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们以花式步法力图避开典型的苏联冲刺.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 招架数值越高，普通攻击、物理类型技能时发动招架(Parry)的机率越高。招架发动时可让该次攻击伤害减半。

由于帕里(Parry)的影响，他的名作康塔塔《生日》(Dies Natalis)追循到J.S.巴赫声乐作品风格；同样丰富的想像力给予他永不枯竭的感 …

191.简单防守：simple parry192.复杂防守：compound parry193.反防守：counter-parry; parry of detachment.
位于美国麻萨诸塞州塞勒姆的环天顶弧,摄于2012年10月27日。影像中同时可见太阳上侧弧(Supralateral arc)、彩晕弧(Parry arc)和上正切晕弧(Upper tangent arc)。.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: probably representing French parez! 'ward off!', imperative of parer, from Italian parare 'ward off'

entry.def: If you parry a question or argument, you cleverly avoid answering it or dealing with it.

example.ex: In an awkward press conference, Mr King parried questions on the allegations.
example.tran: 在一场尴尬的新闻发布会上，金先生回避了有关指控的问题。

entry.def: If you parry a blow from someone who is attacking you, you push aside their arm or weapon so that you are not hurt.

example.ex: I did not want to wound him, but to restrict myself to defence, to parry his attacks...
example.tran: 我不想伤害他，只是想自我防卫，挡开他的攻击。

example.ex: I parried, and that's when my sword broke.
example.tran: 我挡了一下，把我的剑挡断了。

means.word_mean: 1. a return punch (especially by a boxer)
1. impede the movement of (an opponent or a ball);
2. avoid or try to avoid fulfilling, answering, or performing (duties, questions, or issues);

auth_sentence.content: How nice to see that G. B. Parry agrees.
auth_sentence.res_content: How nice to see that G. B. Parry agrees.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: How nice to see that G. B. Parry agrees.

means.word_mean: 挡开, 避开, 闪开(打击、武器)

sentences.en: He parried the unwelcome question very skilfully.
sentences.cn: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。
